name: La Quinta Resort & Club, A Waldorf Astoria Resort

reviews.text: Have just spent four days at La Quinta before returning to Australia. This resort is really fantastic - the rooms are spacious and the bed very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and the food on site terrific especially the Mexican restaurant. Played at four of the adjacent golf courses which were reasonably priced and good courses. I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Fantastic resort

reviews.text: On Memorial Day weekend this year (May 27th through 31st) we stayed at La Quinta. We had two families which included adults, 2 children under 10 and 2 teenagers. We had a great weekend but what made it great is that everything we needed was accommodated by Adrian who worked at the Front Desk. He was very hospitable, gracious, accommodated us in every way. We had a great great weekend and mostly because of Adrian. We hope that Adrian will remain with La Quinta for a long time. Because of Adrian we will be staying at La Quinta every time we plan to visit Palm Springs (which is usually 3-4 times a year).
reviews.title: Superb Service from Adrian at the Front Desk

reviews.text: We go so often sometimes I forget what a great resort La Quinta is. In fact we take it for granted. Although there has been a steady stream of new personnel, the front desk staff still go out of their to accommodate its guests. You really feel special when you are there. I would ask for the front desk manager Adrian Garcia. Adrian was helpful, courteous and made my wife and family feel like we were the most important guests at the resort/ He was helpful without being phony. I recomend requesting him if you are planning a trip to this magnificent resort. There are alot of newer resorts popping up, but La Quinta is still the best resort in the desert.
reviews.title: still a top notch resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should preface this by saying that we stayed here thanks to priceline.com, and were staying in what had to be the older rooms. There are alot of glowing reviews on here, but I just don't see it. Our room was old and not very clean , we had a terrible time with parking and the pool area didn't seem all that special. We visited another resort, and it seemed much, much nicer than La Quinta.
reviews.title: Did I miss something? Room was very average, resort looked okay.

reviews.text: Sorry, but I can't recommend this place.
reviews.title: Relaxing Setting, Awesome Resort & BEST Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredible property. I loved having the private pool and spa. The food was wonderful. It was enjoyed by our entire group and I am sure that we will return.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Stayed for my 6th time at the resort but the first time in the old original casitas. The bed was wonderful and a smaller room but a large bathrrom. The grounds even in the summer are just beautiful with flowerbeds every where.
reviews.title: If you can take the heat summer rates are great

reviews.text: While the staff was outstanding, the upkeep and general appearance of the pools and surrounding areas was quite disappointing. The pool area was never cleaned during our stay (Tues - Sat); the trash that was on the ground and in the bushes when we arrived was still there at our departure. The pools were too warm, near warm bath water temperature, and the filters and/or skimmers didn't appear to be working at full capacity evidenced by the many bugs in the pool. The pool furniture was dirty and several pieces appeared broken or near their breaking point and the flies drove people away from the pool and back into their rooms. Although the housekeeping department did a very thorough and complete cleaning daily, the rooms appear to be nearing their end point and will be needing upgrounds. Also, the rooms were very noisy and with pool hours of 7 am to 11 pm, you could count on less than 8 hours of sleep a night. All in all, the staff experience was wonderful but I don't think we'll return here in the near future.
reviews.title: Great staff but disappointed overall

reviews.text: I gave myself a mini vacation and booked a Getaway Casita at the La Quinta resort. The Getaway Casitas & Suites come with a private hot tub and yard with outdoor furniture. The suite comes with a kitchenette, while the casita is basically just a large hotel room with mini fridge that has an ice maker (great!) and mini bar drinks, some counter space but no sink, except in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, great stay... but pricey for the room quality.

reviews.text: I did have a wonderful time, but found my experience to be the same as my previous stays at the Waldorf in NYC (owned by the same group).... The public spaces are gorgeous and well planned/designed and kept, the staff are friendly and attentive while in public places. The food and options for food were above par (for hotels) so I really don't mind paying the additional $$. I know I am paying a premium for convenience, atmosphere and not having to pack up and drive somewhere. The downside is that the rooms mostly seem to be an afterthought and do need some tlc. I don't want them to get rid of the old tile, or the adobe/stucco look of it. I like the classic charm and beauty. I just feel like the rooms are not cleaned as well as they should be (excepting the linens, which are great). Nothing seemed gross, just not well taken care of, or not kept up like it should. Some examples: The sconce on the bathroom light was burned on one side and not replaced, the window shades had poles in them to keep them straight, but 90% were sticking out of the shades and needed to be pushed back in so you didn't get scratched when opening them, the bathroom floor had stuff on it (not mud, or anything sticky... it just needed a better vacuum) the pulls on the dresser were sticky, the doors didn't hang well, the ice box was in desperate need of a good rinse, there was dust in the room in areas, one light switch didn't work, outside I found cigarette butts in my yard as well as pieces of un-chewed gum that the ants were loving, the chairs and table needed a desperate dusting and cobweb removal, the stucco around the casita needed a little finishing, the vent cover in the hot tub was not attached and kept slipping off and could cause a trip. The hot tub in general needed some love. It looked great, again love the "casita" style, but it was like sandpaper to walk and sit on and many of the tiles were cracked. Again, I don't mind the old look, even cracked tiles, but the patching should be done better and to pay an extra $200/nt for a hot tub that hurts to walk into or sit in is asking a bit much.
reviews.title: Making it a tradition

reviews.text: We stayed 7/30-31/2010. Our room was run down, and we found trash under the bed. The bathtub had a big chip off of it and the water closet baseboard was peeling. The cocktails at the pool were watered down. Unimpressed.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Although the sun was beating down at a strong 116 degrees, the weekend was filled with relaxation and fun. The rooms were quite roomy and the bathrooms were spacious. The air-conditioning in the rooms also saved us. The mexican restaurant had great drinks and even better food. It made for a good time. Also I would recommend getting a cabana pool-side because its a nice way to escape the sun and the service was great. From the moment we go into the hotel we were greeted by great service, cool towlettes and cold lemonade. The trip was filled with relaxation and great service. We never once had any problems! I would definitely recommend this to everyone. Kids friendly, but also adult friendly. It makes for a great time!
reviews.title: Great Time with Great Friends

reviews.text: My wife and I had the opportunity to stay here for 4 days in June. It was more than I expected and a great value at that. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful; they seemed to take delight in going out of their way to make one's stay memorable.
reviews.title: Great hotel with beatiful grounds and great service

reviews.text: Me and my friends stayed at this resort for the weekend, and although the weather was scorching hot, we still had an amazing time! Any room you stay in will have a pool right outside the door to jump in at any hours, and the main pool with cabanas and a bar make it easy to stay cool. The service made us feel like VIP guests, and the manager Evan was quick to help us with anything we needed. Definitely the place to go for a relaxing getaway!
reviews.title: Amazing place to relax!!!

reviews.text: Staying at La Quinta was paradise. The staff was so nice and would do anything to make sure my friends and I felt comfortable. Every staff member I talked to was very informative about any questions I had. One morning we left early to get breakfast we can back not even 30 minutes later and our room was already cleaned, which was awesome! Overall it is such a great place to stay because it is so beautiful and the staff is amazing.
reviews.title: Great trip!

reviews.text: My partner and I spent a few days here with family and it was fantastic. The group of 8 had a blast at the resort with the upgrading of 3 rooms to a Spa Villa. The Villa was awesome in size, décor and layout. We would all relax, cook and hang by the pool right next to the Villa. Each of the bedrooms had a terrace and fireplace. The Villa stood alone so we heard not a soul. The service was excellent as we needed a motorized golf cart for one of our party and they were always prompt and helpful when we needed them. Room service was fast and good. Everybody from the grounds men to the maids would always great you while walking the resort. Even the guest say hello! It all adds to the very causal style of the resort.
reviews.title: Truely Awesome American Resort in the Desert

reviews.text: The resort as a whole is huge and well kept let alone incredibly beautiful. It looks onto the Mountains and at dusk just truly delightful with cocktail in hand. The maid service was excellent (and the Villa took some cleaning each day) and normally they had 3 to deal with the rooms so it happened quickly. The resort is pet friendly (even thou the summer heat was not). We ate the restaurant and it was very good in regards to food and service. Actually, Steve the waiter was a hoot with this large group!
reviews.title: Beautiful Place to Stay with Great Service

reviews.text: Again, I would totally recommend this resort for a fantastic family getaway - It really was five stars due to the villa, service and property! I will be back again!
reviews.title: Made me want to cry...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My best friend and I went for her Birthday.... The valet ane bell guys so nice, took us to our room on a golf cart very cool. Our room was perfect it was a suite with a living room and kitchen as well. We went to the main pool very nice and great drinks and food off the pool menu. That night we dined at Morgans can you say amazing :) Wow I had the halibut yummy and she had a steak with all the amazing sides.
reviews.title: Morgan's restaurant was fabulous

reviews.text: The next day we went to the Spa wow what an experince best massage ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Loved it and the wet steam room so nice. They have a great outdoor lounge area with nice teas, water and fruit.
reviews.title: Things Have Improved

reviews.text: My weekend get-a-way to La Quinta this last weekend was absolutely the best I could ever ask for. We were celebrating a birthday and everything exceeded our expectations. From the check-in - there was an amazing grapefruit water served to us, to the 21 and over bar being the place to be seen! The staff was more than gracious and accomodating. I would definitely recommend this resort if you want to relax, enjoy the pool and eat at the amazing Mexican restaurant on-site.
reviews.title: La Quinta is the BEST!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been multiple times and will continue - always the best experience!!
reviews.title: Favorite Vacation Destination for R&R

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I LOVE La Quinta!! This is my favorite place to unwind, and I come here every summer, and I love that is is Pet Freindly. Beautifully maintained grounds, spacious rooms, excellent room service (Breakfast burrito is Amazing!). I am almost always upgraded at check-in, and it doesnt hurt to ask. If you come in summer when it is slow, the rooms are totally inexpensive and you basically get your pick of pools in the resort. The downside is they are all hot like bathwater because it is so hot, but the main pool is always cooler and there is a bar. No need to leave the property, everything you need is there - So Relaxing!!
reviews.title: Wow – What a Beautiful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the La Qunita Resort for our 4th wedding anniversary for a short weekend trip. As soon as we walked in the lobby, we were welcome by a lady who offered us some cold water or a citrus drink. Checking in early was no problem. We told the front desk clerk it was our anniversary and she arranged for some champagne to be sent to our room.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay, Although Don't Let The Name Waldorf Astoria Mislead You

reviews.text: We stayed in a 1 bedroom Spa Villa Suite. The villa suite felt more an apartment than a suite. It had a full kitchen with an ice maker, two bathrooms, two patios, a fire place, a washer and dryer, two TVs and a large bed room with a table, a desk and a king size bed. Outside of our patio, was a large pool (1 of the resorts 41 pools,). Everything in the villa was modern and up to date. The TV in the front room had game controllers and a DVD player.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Had a fantastic, romantic getaway! Great service!
reviews.text: We had our 15th wedding anniversary trip for 4 nights at La Quinta. It was our first time there. Everyone at the resort was friendly and helpful. The resort was not crowded. BILL at the pool was awesome! He took care of us like family. He made sure our celebration was extremely special. We want to thank him for his excellent service!! The bell desk was also very helpful, and we golfed and the Mountain Dunes course was great. All in all a very relaxing, beautiful place to stay.

I am able to write this review whilst still at La Quinta thanks to the high speed internet access direct to the room. This is all included in the rate and it is reliable and fast. Beyond the room there is efficient wifi.
reviews.title: It's all positive at La Quinta

reviews.text: I cannot fault La Quinta, from the setting to the staff to the amenities. Car parking is especially good, the spaces being near the rooms but discreet enough to be out of sight.
reviews.title: Zoom Zoom Whirrrrrrrr - Cart !!

reviews.text: The weather may be hot in August but we knew that, and here there is shade aplenty and pools everywhere into which you can jump or laze depending upon your mood.
reviews.title: great time there everyone was very curteous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are, as you would expect at a high end resort such as this well trained and courteous. I would like to thank Delia and Alyssa on the front desk. We had a small problem, and I judge a hotel not by everything being perfect first time, but actually the customer response when assistance is required. Our issue was resolved, (and it was not actually of the hotel's making it was related to other guests) so now in a perverse kind of a way we are even more satisfied with the resort as a result of the rapid response. when we discussed what had bothered us.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: outstanding grounds, great food, shopping, spa treatments, golf, tennis. wonderful, helpful staff, beautiful pools, comfy beds. this place is just perfect. stayed multiple times and can't wait to get back to the starlight casitas.
reviews.title: Finest Desert Resort! You must stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points - pool right outside door, spacious & nicely decorated room, comfortable bed, really friendly & helpful staff - especially in Morgans and Twenty6 restaurants, concierge full of suggestions, great food & cocktails, short drive away from local restaurants for a bit of variety, car parking close to room, lovely gardens which are obviously well looked after.
reviews.title: Quiet but relaxing

reviews.text: Not so good - pool could have done with a bit of a clean - water was OK but dead bugs didn't get removed in 5 days and there was a layer of grime on the tiles above the water line, pool towels not the most luxurious and only one each
reviews.title: Who could possibly give this place a bad review?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good or bad depending on viewpoint - seemed very quiet - for 2 days we were practically the only people at our pool, and restaurants weren't busy.
reviews.title: Romantic Get Away

reviews.text: Not the hotel's fault, but something to be aware of - we removed at least 10 dead bees from our pool. Possibly happened because they were trimming trees & hedges. Wear your pool shoes in case you stand on one.
reviews.title: Would return

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel. They treated the kids very well by giving them free swim goggles as well as the rubber duckies. Everything seemed to be perfect here. We normally stay in the Palm Desert/Indian Wells/La Quinta area about 6-8 times per year.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Service

reviews.text: La Quinta's unique history and spectacular setting give it a great deal of charm. But that charm only goes so far. Like some other reviewers I found the front desk staff to be not at all charming or helpful. A traveler's experience at the front desk - the first impression - often sets the tone for the entire stay. In my opinion, the resort's management needs to give front desk staff a refresher course on customer service.
reviews.title: Charming but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also feel that the resort is putting too much stock in quaintness and history, and not enough in cleanliness and modernity. The tile floor in the bathroom with the dirty-looking grout lines made me want to go buy a Clorox bleach pen and a scrub brush. And I'm not suffering from OCD. It just creeps me out to be walking barefoot over something that looks so old and dirty. History, yes. History of DNA from other travelers, no.
reviews.title: one of my favorite vocations i had so far

reviews.text: It was incredibly hot when we were there (over 100 degrees F) and we could only be outside very early in the morning and very late at night. The rest of the time, we had to stay inside with a/c blasting. I'd go back, but only in the winter, and only if I got an incredible deal on the room.
reviews.title: Great Service, Awesome Pools, Fun times for ALL!

reviews.text: i stayed at La quinta with my husband and my dog( a pitbull) which is always being discriminated and called a killer . I love to travel with my dog and been many places but i never experinenced a such a welcome for my dog .The office provided my dog with a bed ,bolws and a treat . i had no problems there ,i took my dog with us to the pool and around the property and all staff were very friendly. We swim at pool till 3-00am and no one kicked us out .I guess their pools stay open all night ,not like most resorts. My room was wonderfull ,we had a huge back yard with a tree ,grass and umbrella. Which was perfect for my dog.It was a very privite location ,you can tan naket if you wish and no one to see (no cameras). The bathroom was amazing and big , huge tub and separete large shower ( big enouth to wash a horse) I am going back there in 2 days , and i am so exited ,it is so beatifull there and so many pools to shoose from . i would recomend this resort for everyone ,neither if its your romantic getaway or a family vocation it is perfect for both ,just make sure to mention what you desire , front dest is very helpfull and do all they can to make your saty satisfying.
reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!

description: La Quinta Resort & Club and PGA WEST® is a world-renowned Southern California desert retreat featuring 796 elegantly appointed casitas, suites and villas; the 23,000-square-foot Spa La Quinta® with 41 pools and 53 hot spas; 41 tennis courts; over 100,000 square feet of indoor and outdoor meeting and banquet facilities; and exceptional cuisine at Morgan’s in the desert, TWENTY6 and Adobe Grill. Known as The Western Home of Golf in America® and named ”North America’s Golf Resort of the Year,” it is home to five award-winning golf courses and four private courses – designed by legends Arnold Palmer, Jack Nicklaus, Pete Dye, Greg Norman and Tom Weiskopf. Golf instruction is offered at the PGA WEST Golf Academy.
